node.title: Take on EVs? What Australia can learn from Norway and 80s synth-pop band A-ha
node.alt: Five electric vehicles parked on a snowy fjord waterfront
node.description: Norway is leading the world in EV adoption, while Australia seems stuck in first gear.Â How can we catch up?
node.content:
["A combination of cheaper electric vehicles (EVs) and generous financial incentives has seen an unprecedented number of Norwegians switching from diesel-powered cars to battery ones over the past decade.", "EVs have gone from making up less than\u00a02 per cent of new car sales to more than three quarters, and the\u00a0oil-rich nation has become an unlikely example to the rest of the world of\u00a0how to accelerate the uptake of EVs.", "As it happens, Australia is at a similar point\u00a0to where\u00a0Norway was at in 2011, with EVs making up about 1.6 per cent of new car sales.", "So, what would it take to \"do a Norway\" and engineer an EV sales boom?\u00a0", "
EVs in Norway are cheaper than regular cars
", "In the early 1990s, Norway began introducing the policies that would later drive an EV transition, including abolishing or waiving various taxes to reduce the up-front and lifetime cost of EVs.", "Strangely enough, one\u00a0catalyst for this was the Norwegian '80s synth-pop band A-ha, otherwise best known for the song Take On Me.", "", "
Members of the group A-ha with the Fiat Panda converted EV.(Supplied: Bellona)
", "In 1989, two members of the trio bought a converted EV (range: 45km) and drove it around Norway, stubbornly\u00a0refusing to pay road tolls or\u00a0registration, to\u00a0protest\u00a0the disincentives to owning an electric car.", "The government caved and waived the\u00a0tolls and fees for EVs, which cost little because there were so few EVs at the time.", "Unintentionally, however, it had introduced the first EV purchase incentives and laid the groundwork for the coming boom in EV sales.", "In 2001, the most important of these incentives was introduced when\u00a0EVs were made exempt from the hefty 25 per cent GST.", "All up, EVs in Norway are cheaper to buy than regular cars.", "This graph\u00a0compares the cost of an EV and the equivalent petrol car in Norway in November 2020.", "", "
How much did\u00a0a new VW Golf cost in Norway in 2020?\u00a0 The electric vehicle was cheaper than the petrol despite having a higher import price.(Supplied: Norwegian EV Association)
", "The tax breaks, combined with lower ongoing fuel and maintenance costs and\u00a0reduced fees for toll roads and parking,\u00a0makes a persuasive economic argument,\u00a0says\u00a0Snorre Sletvold, business developer for the Norwegian EV Association.", "\"I think you need purchase incentives,\" he said.", "\"Maybe not zero per cent sales tax\u00a0like we have in Norway, but some subsidies to kick off the markets.\"", "Once enough people start buying EVs, others follow, he says.", "Sales snowball through personal recommendations, or what he calls \"neighbourhood effect\".", "\"We have the people talking to each other in the neighbourhood, they say, 'You're using an EV,\u00a0don't you run out of energy on your battery?'", "\"They say,\u00a0'No, not at all, it works pretty well.'\"", "
How can Australia boost EV sales?
", "In 2017, Australia's two clean energy agencies, ARENA and the CEFC, commissioned research and advisory firm Energeia\u00a0to study the Australian EV market and identify the policy and regulation levers that would encourage more Australians to switch to EVs.", "Energeia found\u00a0EV rebates would have a two-fold effect on EV uptake, managing director Ezra Beeman said.", "\"The first effect was people would buy more vehicles because they were cheaper, and the second effect was that\u00a0manufacturers would offer more vehicles [to the Australian market],\" he said.", "Lack of choice is a big reason\u00a0Australians\u00a0aren't buying EVs, Mr Beeman said.", "", "
Volkswagen\u00a0will sell about 400,000 EVS worldwide this year,\u00a0but none of them will be in Australia.(Getty: Sean Gallup)
", "The Energeia report concluded that\u00a0a relatively small government rebate in Australia would have a significant effect on EV sales.", "An \"aggressive push\" to support EVs, including better public charging infrastructure, policies to support the import of more models, and purchase incentives equivalent to about $5,500 per car, would drive a marked increase in sales, the report found.", "Under this scenario, it was predicted that EVs would make up 64 per cent of new car sales by 2030.", "That's more than twice the predicted rate under current policy settings, which do not include national purchase incentives (though there are state and territory ones of varying amounts).", "
Australians are willing to pay more for EVs
", "As soon as EVs work out to be\u00a0slightly cheaper than petrol cars over their lifetime, the balance tips and people flock to buy them, Mr Beeman says.", "Jake Whitehead, a transport expert at the University of Queensland, agreed.", "Incentives don't need to make EVs cheaper to buy than conventional cars, they just need to make EVs a little less expensive,\u00a0he said.", "\"The average Australian is willing to spend somewhere in the order of $8,000-$10,000\u00a0more for an EV compared to a\u00a0petrol equivalent,\" he said.", "This isn't necessarily for altruistic reasons, but because they calculate they'll save money over the lifetime of the vehicle, through lower energy and maintenance costs.", "But the narrowest price gap between an EV and its petrol equivalent in Australia\u00a0is\u00a0closer to $15,000 \u2014 and typically\u00a0a lot more.", "The cheapest electric car in Australia is the MG ZS EV, which starts at\u00a0$40,990, or about $15,000\u00a0more than the petrol version.", "The very best EV purchase incentive in Australia right now is about $5,500 \u2014\u00a0and that's a rare scenario, applying to someone in NSW who receives\u00a0the subsidy and avoids\u00a0stamp duty on a $68,000 EV, and without taking into account the road tax they'll have to pay from 2027.", "Most Australians, however, have access to incentives\u00a0far smaller than that.", "", "
The Tesla Model 3 is by far the best-selling electric car in Australia this year.(AP: Justin Pritchard)
", "
How much do EV incentives need to be in Australia?
", "Dr Whitehouse says the magic figure for an\u00a0incentive that would\u00a0bridge enough of the price gap to be effective is about $7,500.", "This would put the size of Australia's incentive\u00a0somewhere between\u00a0what's offered by\u00a0the UK and the US.", "\"I wouldn't advocate for the\u00a0$7,500 to be just given to [EV buyers],\" Dr Whitehead said.", "\"You could have exemptions from the stamp duty that every state and territory levies and\u00a0save about $1,500 there.\u00a0Add in waiving registration\u00a0for five\u00a0years and that adds up close to $4,000.\"", "And how much would this cost?", "Josh Quiggin, an economist at the University of Queensland, has estimated that a national EV subsidy or tax exemption to the value of\u00a0$10,000 per EV would cost around $1 billion a year.", "The amount would decline as EVs get cheaper, he added.", "
What's the cost of not introducing EV subsidies?
", "The\u00a0government's Future Fuels strategy, released last week, ruled subsidies out, stating that \"reducing the total cost of ownership through subsidies would not represent value for the taxpayer.\"", "Instead of subsiding EVs, Australia is waiting for them to get cheaper.\u00a0", "This is happening, but slowly.", "Greater economies of scale and cheaper batteries mean larger vehicles such as electric sedans and SUVs will be the same price as petrol equivalents by 2026, with small cars to follow in 2027, according to Bloomberg market research.", "Energeia's Mr Beeman made a similar forecast.", "The problem with waiting, he says, is that people keep buying combustion-engine cars that lock in future emissions.", "There are about 20 million registered motor vehicles in Australia with an average age of 10 years.", "", "
Poor EV take-up could cost Ausralia's health system $1 trillion by 2050 through air, noise, water and greenhouse pollution, according to one economic study.(AAP: Julian Smith)
", "Australians buy about 1 million vehicles per year, so it takes a while for the fleet to be replaced.", "Under the current plan, where 30 per cent of new vehicles\u00a0sales are EVs by 2030,\u00a0close to 90 per cent of vehicles on the road will still have combustion engines.", "It will take many years of 100 per cent EV sales to reduce the number of combustion-engine cars on the road.", "Delaying the switch to EVs\u00a0will make it harder to meet Australia's commitment to reduce domestic emissions to net zero by 2050.", "Even though almost 80 per cent of new car sales in Norway\u00a0are EVs, 85 per cent of cars on the road are still petrol or diesel, the\u00a0Norway EV Association's Mr Sletvold says.", "Norway's\u00a0proportion of combustion-engine vehicles\u00a0is\u00a0falling by about 5 per cent every two years.", "\"We still have some problems,\" he said.", "\"We still need to build more charging stations because in Norway, people love to go to their cabin on the weekend.\"", "But he's confident\u00a0the problems\u00a0can be solved and the EV won't kill the\u00a0weekend."]
